title: I Built An AI Receptionist For A Med Spa
hook: I built an AI receptionist for a med spa. Here's what happened in 30 days.
notes: WORD-FOR-WORD format copy from viral video. Adapt to med spa niche.
content:
I built an AI receptionist for a med spa. Here's what happened in 30 days.

This med spa was losing 40% of their calls to voicemail. Botox, fillers, laser treatments — gone to competitors.

So I built them an AI that:
- Answers every call in 2 seconds
- Books appointments 24/7
- Speaks English and Spanish
- Knows their entire menu and pricing

First week: 847 calls answered. Zero went to voicemail.

Week two: They noticed something weird. Appointments were booking at 11pm. At 2am. At 6am on Sunday.

Turns out 40% of their ideal clients — busy professionals — can only call outside business hours.

Month one results:
- 94% booking rate
- $11,400 in recovered revenue
- Staff focusing on patients, not phones

The owner told me: "This is like having a receptionist that never sleeps, never calls in sick, and never puts anyone on hold."

Comment 'DEMO' if you want to see how it works for your practice.

title: This AI Just Replaced A $50K/Year Employee
hook: This AI just replaced a $50,000 a year employee. And it only costs $500 a month.
notes: Proven viral format: shocking cost comparison
content:
This AI just replaced a $50,000 a year employee. And it only costs $500 a month.

Here's what it does:

Answers every phone call in 2 seconds. No hold music. No voicemail.

Books appointments directly into your calendar. Even at 3am.

Speaks multiple languages. Spanish, Vietnamese, whatever your patients speak.

Follows up with no-shows automatically. No awkward phone calls from your staff.

Never calls in sick. Never takes vacation. Never has a bad day.

One med spa owner told me they recovered $4,200 in their first month just from calls they were missing.

Another said patients couldn't tell it wasn't human.

The math is simple:
$50K employee vs $6K/year AI.

Same results. 90% less cost.

Comment 'AI' and I'll show you how it works.

title: Why Med Spas Are Firing Their Receptionists
hook: Why med spas are firing their receptionists. And it's not what you think.
notes: Contrarian/surprising action hook - proven viral format
content:
Why med spas are firing their receptionists. And it's not what you think.

It's not because they're bad employees.

It's because of math.

A receptionist can only answer one call at a time. The rest go to voicemail.

70% of people who hit voicemail never call back. They call your competitor instead.

That's not a missed call. That's a $300 Botox appointment walking out the door.

So smart owners are doing something different.

They're keeping their receptionist for in-person patient care.

And letting AI handle the phones.

The AI answers every call in 2 seconds. Books appointments 24/7. Even in Spanish.

One owner went from 60% booked to 95% booked in 30 days.

Same staff. Same hours. 35% more revenue.

The receptionist isn't getting fired. She's getting promoted to what she's actually good at — taking care of patients.

Comment 'LEARN' to see how it works.

title: I Let AI Run A Med Spa For 30 Days
hook: I let AI run a med spa for 30 days. Here's what happened.
notes: Challenge format - extremely viral on TikTok/YouTube
content:
I let AI run a med spa for 30 days. Here's what happened.

Day 1: Connected the AI to their phone system. It started answering calls immediately.

Day 3: First 2am booking came through. A nurse who just got off shift wanted Botox before her vacation.

Day 7: The AI had answered 312 calls. Zero went to voicemail. Staff was confused — the phone barely rang anymore.

Day 14: Owner noticed something. Revenue was up 18%. But they hadn't changed anything else.

Day 21: A patient left a 5-star review saying the "receptionist" was the friendliest she'd ever talked to. It was the AI.

Day 30: Final results.
- 847 calls answered
- $11,400 in revenue they would have lost
- 94% booking rate
- Staff morale up because they weren't chained to the phone

The owner's exact words: "Why didn't I do this a year ago?"

Comment 'RESULTS' if you want to see the full breakdown.

title: The 2AM Test That Changed Everything
hook: I called a med spa at 2am to see what would happen. This changed everything.
notes: Personal test/story hook - high engagement format
content:
I called a med spa at 2am to see what would happen. This changed everything.

Most med spas: straight to voicemail. "Leave a message and we'll call you back."

But this one? Picked up on the first ring.

A friendly voice asked how she could help. I said I wanted to book Botox.

She asked about my availability, found an opening, and confirmed my appointment — all in 90 seconds.

I thought it was a night shift employee. It wasn't.

It was an AI.

And here's the thing: 40% of people who want treatments can only call outside business hours.

Busy professionals. Night shift workers. Moms after the kids are asleep.

Every med spa that sends those calls to voicemail is handing money to their competitors.

This one doesn't.

Comment 'DEMO' to see how it sounds.
